revised_title: Supplementary Observations on the Structure of Belemnite and Belemnoteuthis
tldr: The author presents supplementary observations on the structure of Belemnite and Belemnoteuthis, two genera of fossil Cephalopoda found in the Oxford clay of Wiltshire. He describes the external capsule, osselet, and phragmocone structures of the Belemnite, and discusses the differences between the Belemnite and Belemnoteuthis, including their soft parts and arm structures.
